result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke A Schweiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --To pay statutory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge

--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
 
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

--Random drug and/or alcohol screening

--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
 
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
 
 
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Court has no objection to probation transferring to Milwaukee County
  
-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY : JESO

records.addlTxt: per JCSD Defendant is serving the time // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

[MK] case called at 11:45am. 
Defendant Luke A Schweiner in court, in custody, with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith 
--55 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Schweiner is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay the balance due on costs;  the clerk is to mail Mr. Schweiner a payment slip at the Jail, once the amount due is known;  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on6/30/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 15  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess 12:06pm.
Sent to Probation and Parole Attn: Sue Her
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 1:46 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Luke A Schweiner in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
Court has no objection to probation transferring to Milwaukee County

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
Recess: 2:02 pm
with elements and criminal case settlement

Case called at 3:40am [mo]
[Scheduled for Plea Hearing]
Reserve Judge Donald Hassin Jr. presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Luke A Schweiner in court with attorney John Vernon Rhiel.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Teuber submits an Ameded Information
--service of Amended Information admitted, reading waived

In conducting its plea colloquy, the Court raises concern about the Defendant vaguely remembering the incident; the Court does not believe it could accept the plea of Mr. Schweiner.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 3:55pm

NEXT: Status Conference on 1/28/16 at 2:00pm

Case called at 2:25 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for plea/sentencing)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Luke A Schweiner in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel: Needed information regarding Mr. Schweiner's prescription information. Do have information now, but had some miscommuincation and are not ready to proceed at this time. Do request matter be reset for plea. DA Happ is not available to discuss matter as she is preparing for another matter. 
ADA Beck: No objection to setting matter over; appears DA Happ is still looking for more information
Court reminds Mr. Schweiner that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 2:28 pm

NEXT: Schedule Plea Hearing (possible sentencing) 1/8/16 at 3:30 pm - Send notices

Case called at 9:15 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Luke A Schweiner in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel: Was discussing settlement with DA Happ, could possibly settle today. May need another date. 
off-record: 9:15 - 9:18 am for counsel to further discuss
Atty Rhiel: Requests matter be set for plea/sentencing; are close to agreement. DA Happ needs a bit more information before proceeding.
DA Happ: Agreed
Court reminds Defendant that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 9:20 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 12/18/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices

Case called at 2:25pm [mo]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Luke A Schweiner in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr.Schweiner waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
The Court directs that Bail stands as fixed.
recess: 2:30pm

NEXT:   Arraignment on 10/2/15 at 8:30am

[MK] case called at 1:40pm. 
Defendant Luke A Schweine appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Schweine verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no presence at the Days Inn in Johnson Creek
--not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin 
recess 1:43pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/19/15 at 2:20pm   (2) Status Conference on 9/11/15 at 2:00pm.
